Node.definition: = marker identifying a set of multiple objects with a set that already exists in the mind of the hearers
= supreme secular and male ruler of a nation or people; ≈ associated with authority, power, honor, but also with justice; also used as a reference to one's deity

= the earth as opposed to the sky; sometimes used in a more specific sense to denote part of the earth, such as the dry land as opposed to the sea, or a specific region, area, country, or plot of land
= a linker introducing a proposition that gives additional information regarding an explicit or implicit object, location, time, or manner
= direct or indirect human offspring, either male or indeterminate, either biologically or through adoption

= man, also known as Jacob (יַעֲקֹב) and Jeshurun (יְשֻׁרוּן) including the ethnic group that is regarded to be his descendants; ◄ son of Isaac (יִצְחָק) and Rebekah (רִבְקָה) brother of Esau (עֵשָׂו) and ► father of twelve sons after whom the tribes of Israel were named and one daughter
= action by which humans take ownership of land and other possessions

marker identifying the entity that is directly targeted by the event in focus, and which usually is already part of the cognitive context; described in syntactic terms as the direct object marker; untranslatable in English unless accompanied by a suffix

= the earth as opposed to the sky; sometimes used in a more specific sense to denote part of the earth, such as the dry land as opposed to the sea, or a specific region, area, country, or plot of land
= river; ◄ flowing from Mount Hermon (חֶרְמֹון) in a southerly direction through the Sea of Galilee (כִּנֶּרֶת) into the Dead Sea (יָם־הַמֶּלַח)
literally: the rising of the sun: = a cardinal direction indicating the direction of the rising sun
= a relatively steep and narrow valley following the course of a stream, which is often dry, except for the rainy season
= river; ◄ east of the Jordan (יַרְדֵּן) ► constitutes border between Moab (מֹואָב) and Ammon (עַמֹּון)
particle linking an event to a point in space; = relation indicating that event X ends at point in space Y
= a relatively high elevation of the earth’s surface; generally higher than a hill (גִּבְעָה)
= mountain, also known as Senir (שְׂנִיר) Sion (שִׂיאֹון) and Sirion (שִׂרְיֹון) ◄ part of the Anti Lebanon range; located north east of Israel (יִשְׂרָאֵל)
literally: the rising (of the sun): = a cardinal direction indicating the direction of the rising sun
= man; ► king of Amorites (אֱמֹרִי) defeated by Israelites (יִשְׂרָאֵל)
= supreme secular and male ruler of a nation or people; ≈ associated with authority, power, honor, but also with justice; also used as a reference to one's deity
= member of ethnic group; ◄ original inhabitants of Canaan (כְּנַעַן)
= process by which humans make a certain place or area their home

= town; ◄ territory of Gad (גָּד) ► former residence of Sihon (סִיחֹון) king of Amorites (אֱמֹרִי) (who had captured it from Moab (מֹואָב) assigned to clan of Merari (מְרָרִי) tribe of Levi (לֵוִי) later occupied by Moab
= town; ◄ territory of Reuben (רְאוּבֵן)
= a linker introducing a proposition that gives additional information regarding an explicit or implicit object, location, time, or manner
= a relatively steep and narrow valley following the course of a stream, which is often dry, except for the rainy season
= river; ◄ east of the Jordan (יַרְדֵּן) ► constitutes border between Moab (מֹואָב) and Ammon (עַמֹּון)
= a relatively steep and narrow valley following the course of a stream, which is often dry, except for the rainy season
= one part of an object or substance that has been divided into two parts
= area on east side of the Jordan (יַרְדֵּן) ◄ supposedly named after Gilead, son of Makir (מָכִיר) tribe of Manasseh (מְנַשֶּׁה)
particle linking an event to a point in space; = relation indicating that event X ends at point in space Y
= river; ◄ flows west from its source near Rabbath Ammon to empty into the Jordan (יַרְדֵּן) river about 40 kilometers north of the Dead Sea (יָם־הַמֶּלַח)
= a relatively steep and narrow valley following the course of a stream, which is often dry, except for the rainy season
= a set of limits that separates part of a whole from other parts, with focus either on the limits itself or on the area or object surrounded by it
= direct or indirect human offspring, either male or indeterminate, either biologically or through adoption
= nation; ◄ situated E. of river Jordan (יַרְדֵּן) according to founded by Ben Ammi (בֶּן־עַמִּי) son of Lot (לֹוט)
particle linking an event to a point in space; = relation indicating that event X ends at point in space Y

Node.gloss: Sea of Chinnereth|Sea of Kinnereth|Lake Galilee
Node.definition: = a large body of fresh water east of the territory of Galilee, in northern Israel, through which the Jordan River flows
= town; ◄ territory of Naphtali (נַפְתָּלִי) at Sea of Galilee (כִּנֶּרֶת)
literally: the rising (of the sun): = a cardinal direction indicating the direction of the rising sun
particle linking an event to a point in space; = relation indicating that event X ends at point in space Y

literally: the sea of salt; hence: = a large body of salt water located in the basin of the Jordan Valley, east of Judah; the Jordan River flows from the north into the northern part of this sea; the water is so salty that no living organism inhabits them

literally: the sea of salt; hence: = a large body of salt water located in the basin of the Jordan Valley, east of Judah; the Jordan River flows from the north into the northern part of this sea; the water is so salty that no living organism inhabits them
= literally: Sea of Salt; one of the names of the Dead Sea, because of the high concentration of salt in its water
literally: the rising (of the sun): = a cardinal direction indicating the direction of the rising sun

= an open space connecting different places, ► used for travelling and transportation; ≈ often extended to denote our life as a journey from birth to death, and the totality of our activities during our lives
= town; ◄ in the region of Moab (מֹואָב) allotted to the tribe of Reuben (רְאוּבֵן)
= area located to the south of a point of reference
= side of a mountain or hill
= a mountain, ◄ part of the Abarim (עֲבָרִים) range, located in Moab (מֹואָב) northeast of the Dead Sea (יָם־הַמֶּלַח)
= a set of limits that separates part of a whole from other parts, with focus either on the limits itself or on the area or object surrounded by it
= man; ► king of Bashan (בָּשָׁן) defeated by Israelites (יִשְׂרָאֵל)
= supreme secular and male ruler of a nation or people; ≈ associated with authority, power, honor, but also with justice; also used as a reference to one's deity
= region; ◄ north east of the River Jordan (יַרְדֵּן) ► at one time ruled by king Og (עֹוג) later assigned to half of the tribe of Manasseh (מְנַשֶּׁה)
= what remains in existence after part of the original quantity has disappeared or has been used or dealt with in a certain way; used for humans, animals, plants, and inanimate objects
= process by which humans make a certain place or area their home

= town, possibly to be identified with Beeshterah (בְּעֶשְׁתְּרָה) Ashteroth Karnaim (עַשְׁתְּרֹת קַרְנַיִם) and Karnaim (קַרְנַיִם) ◄ territory of Manasseh (מְנַשֶּׁה) east of river Jordan (יַרְדֵּן) ► former residence of king Sihon (סִיחֹון) of Heshbon (חֶשְׁבֹּון) and king Og (עֹוג) of Bashan (בָּשָׁן) conquered by Israelites (יִשְׂרָאֵל) assigned to clan of Gershon (גֵּרְשֹׁון) tribe of Levi (לֵוִי)
= town; ◄ Bashan (בָּשָׁן) ► part of kingdom of Og (עֹוג) and later assigned to Manasseh (מְנַשֶּׁה)
= a relatively high elevation of the earth’s surface; generally higher than a hill (גִּבְעָה)
= mountain, also known as Senir (שְׂנִיר) Sion (שִׂיאֹון) and Sirion (שִׂרְיֹון) ◄ part of the Anti Lebanon range; located north east of Israel (יִשְׂרָאֵל)
= town; ◄ located in Bashan (בָּשָׁן)
= region; ◄ north east of the River Jordan (יַרְדֵּן) ► at one time ruled by king Og (עֹוג) later assigned to half of the tribe of Manasseh (מְנַשֶּׁה)
particle linking an event to a point in space; = relation indicating that event X ends at point in space Y
= a set of limits that separates part of a whole from other parts, with focus either on the limits itself or on the area or object surrounded by it
= inhabitant of Geshur (גְּשׁוּר) a kingdom located between Gilead (גִּלְעָד) Bashan (בָּשָׁן) and Mt. Hermon (חֶרְמֹון)
= inhabitant of Maacah (מַעֲכָה) Maacath (מַעֲכָת)
= one part of an object or substance that has been divided into two parts
= area on east side of the Jordan (יַרְדֵּן) ◄ supposedly named after Gilead, son of Makir (מָכִיר) tribe of Manasseh (מְנַשֶּׁה)
= a set of limits that separates part of a whole from other parts, with focus either on the limits itself or on the area or object surrounded by it
= man; ► king of Amorites (אֱמֹרִי) defeated by Israelites (יִשְׂרָאֵל)
= supreme secular and male ruler of a nation or people; ≈ associated with authority, power, honor, but also with justice; also used as a reference to one's deity

= town; ◄ territory of Gad (גָּד) ► former residence of Sihon (סִיחֹון) king of Amorites (אֱמֹרִי) (who had captured it from Moab (מֹואָב) assigned to clan of Merari (מְרָרִי) tribe of Levi (לֵוִי) later occupied by Moab
= man; ◄ son of Amram (עַמְרָם) and Jochebed (יֹוכֶבֶד) younger brother of Miriam (מִרְיָם) and Aaron (אַהֲרֹן) tribe of Levi (לֵוִי) ► leader of Israel (יִשְׂרָאֵל) during exodus

= man who is under the authority of someone else as that person's legal property, employee, subject, or vassal; or someone who presents himself as such when speaking to someone of importance or praying to God
= deity; ► God of Israel who revealed himself to Moses
= direct or indirect human offspring, either male or indeterminate, either biologically or through adoption

= man, also known as Jacob (יַעֲקֹב) and Jeshurun (יְשֻׁרוּן) including the ethnic group that is regarded to be his descendants; ◄ son of Isaac (יִצְחָק) and Rebekah (רִבְקָה) brother of Esau (עֵשָׂו) and ► father of twelve sons after whom the tribes of Israel were named and one daughter
= man; ◄ son of Amram (עַמְרָם) and Jochebed (יֹוכֶבֶד) younger brother of Miriam (מִרְיָם) and Aaron (אַהֲרֹן) tribe of Levi (לֵוִי) ► leader of Israel (יִשְׂרָאֵל) during exodus

= man who is under the authority of someone else as that person's legal property, employee, subject, or vassal; or someone who presents himself as such when speaking to someone of importance or praying to God
= deity; ► God of Israel who revealed himself to Moses
= an area that has become someone's possession, which often implies that this possession has been granted by God and that it will be passed on to the next generation of the new owner
= member of the tribe of Reuben (רְאוּבֵן)
= member of tribe of Gad (גָּד)
= one part of an object or substance that has been divided into two parts
= group of clans (מִשְׁפָּחָה) united by a common leader
= man, tribe, and territory; ◄ son of Joseph (יֹוסֵף) ► founder of tribe of Manasseh (מְנַשֶּׁה)
= marker identifying a set of multiple objects with a set that already exists in the mind of the hearers
= supreme secular and male ruler of a nation or people; ≈ associated with authority, power, honor, but also with justice; also used as a reference to one's deity

= the earth as opposed to the sky; sometimes used in a more specific sense to denote part of the earth, such as the dry land as opposed to the sea, or a specific region, area, country, or plot of land
= a linker introducing a proposition that gives additional information regarding an explicit or implicit object, location, time, or manner

= man, also known as Hoshea (הֹושֵׁעַ) and Jeshua (יֵשׁוּעַ) ◄ son of Nun (נוּן) tribe of Ephraim (אֶפְרַיִם) ► one of the twelve men sent by Moses (מֹשֶׁה) to spy out the land; his name was Hoshea, later changed by Moses to Joshua (יְהֹושֻׁעַ) Moses' assistant, who later became his successor and brought Israel (יִשְׂרָאֵל) into Canaan (כְּנַעַן)
= direct or indirect human offspring, either male or indeterminate, either biologically or through adoption

= man, also known as Jacob (יַעֲקֹב) and Jeshurun (יְשֻׁרוּן) including the ethnic group that is regarded to be his descendants; ◄ son of Isaac (יִצְחָק) and Rebekah (רִבְקָה) brother of Esau (עֵשָׂו) and ► father of twelve sons after whom the tribes of Israel were named and one daughter
= river; ◄ flowing from Mount Hermon (חֶרְמֹון) in a southerly direction through the Sea of Galilee (כִּנֶּרֶת) into the Dead Sea (יָם־הַמֶּלַח)
literally: the sea; = a cardinal direction pointing towards the west, ◄ which, in Israel, is the direction towards the Mediterranean Sea
= town; ◄ located at the foot of Mount Hermon (חֶרְמֹון) ► associated with worship of the god of Fortune (גָּד)
= a more or less flat and relatively low region, usually between uplands, hills or mountains, and following the course of a stream
= range of mountains; ◄ north of Israel (יִשְׂרָאֵל) ► known for the cedar (אֶרֶז) and other trees growing there
particle linking an event to a point in space; = relation indicating that event X ends at point in space Y
= a relatively high elevation of the earth’s surface; generally higher than a hill (גִּבְעָה)
= state in which an object has a relatively even and regular surface, free from perceptible projections or lumps or indentations; ≈ often associated with danger and insincerity
literally: to go up; hence: = state in which one side of an area is at a higher elevation than the other
= mountainous area east of the Jordan (יַרְדֵּן) valley and south of Moab (מֹואָב) first inhabited by the Horites (חֹרִי) and later by the Edomites (אֲדֹומִי)

= man, also known as Hoshea (הֹושֵׁעַ) and Jeshua (יֵשׁוּעַ) ◄ son of Nun (נוּן) tribe of Ephraim (אֶפְרַיִם) ► one of the twelve men sent by Moses (מֹשֶׁה) to spy out the land; his name was Hoshea, later changed by Moses to Joshua (יְהֹושֻׁעַ) Moses' assistant, who later became his successor and brought Israel (יִשְׂרָאֵל) into Canaan (כְּנַעַן)
= group of clans (מִשְׁפָּחָה) united by a common leader

= man, also known as Jacob (יַעֲקֹב) and Jeshurun (יְשֻׁרוּן) including the ethnic group that is regarded to be his descendants; ◄ son of Isaac (יִצְחָק) and Rebekah (רִבְקָה) brother of Esau (עֵשָׂו) and ► father of twelve sons after whom the tribes of Israel were named and one daughter
= an area that has become someone's possession, which often implies that this possession has been granted by God and that it will be passed on to the next generation of the new owner
= a group of people within a larger group, placed together for a particular task or duty
= an area dominated by elevations of the earth's surface

literally: the lowland; = the area situated between the hill country (הַר) and the coastal plain, which consists of foothills; named thus by the Israelites who occupied the hill country; known for its olive trees (זַיִת) and sycamore trees (שִׁקְמָה)
= the eastern part of the hill country (הַר) that slopes down towards the Dead Sea (יָם־הַמֶּלַח) and the Jordan Valley
= area not very suitable for sedentary life and agriculture because of its lack of water; suitable for grazing domestic animals and only inhabited by nomadic tribes and wild animals

= an area of land located in the south of Israel (יִשְׂרָאֵל) consisting of little vegetation and with very little annual rainfall; inhabited by numerous peoples initially by the Canaanites in Arad (עֲרָד) and the Amelekites (עֲמָלֵקִי) later, the people of Judah (יְהוּדָה)
= member of ethnic group inhabiting Canaan (כְּנַעַן) before arrival of Israelites (יִשְׂרָאֵל) ◄ regarded as descendants of Heth (חֵת)
= member of ethnic group; ◄ original inhabitants of Canaan (כְּנַעַן)
= descendant of Canaan (כְּנַעַן) son of Ham (חָם) son of Noah (נֹחַ) and inhabitant of the country named after them
= member of ethnic group; ◄ original inhabitants of Canaan (כְּנַעַן)
= ethnic group; ◄ considered descendants of Canaan (כְּנַעַן)
= inhabitant of Jebus (יְבוּס) ◄ original inhabitants of Canaan (כְּנַעַן)
= supreme secular and male ruler of a nation or people; ≈ associated with authority, power, honor, but also with justice; also used as a reference to one's deity
= town; ◄ located northwest of the Dead Sea (יָם־הַמֶּלַח) territory of Benjamin (בִּנְיָמִן) ► first town conquered by Israel (יִשְׂרָאֵל) after they entered Canaan (כְּנַעַן)
